result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Murillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample. 

Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of payments of all costs and DNA being provided/completed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Murillo

Case Called: 1:34 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall in person:
Defendant appears in person, pro se.;
VRCW.
Court advises the Defendant of his right to counsel; Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel at this time.
Court finds waiver of counsel is being made freely, intelligently, and knowingly. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights and Counsel filed.   
PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (DC)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 1 (DC)>> $50 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Forfeiture of the BB Gun used in the incident. Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office. Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of payments of all costs and DNA being provided/completed.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears pro se. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

- No contact with victim(s):  L.D.G., M.E.G.
